thread.title: Hundreds of NYC bodegas to close in protest of Trump travel ban
thread.title_full: Hundreds of NYC bodegas to close in protest of Trump travel ban

author: Leonard Greene, Adam Shrier
title: Hundreds of NYC bodegas to close in protest of Trump travel ban
text:
Trump's travel ban prompts hundreds of city bodegas to protest by closing their doors for eight hours Hundreds of NYC bodegas to close in protest of Trump travel ban Public Advocate Letitia James (l.) said "no ban will stop us" at a Foley Square protest of the executive order. (Sam Costanza/for New York Daily News) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   8:37 PM 
Hundreds of bodegas from Bed-Stuy to the Bowery will shut down for eight hours Thursday to protest President Trump’s travel ban . 
Yemeni store owners will close days after yellow cab drivers went on strike to protest the executive order. Yemen is one of the seven countries on the banned travel list. Meanwhile, thousands of protesters filled Foley Square Wednesday to sound off against the ban. 
“This is our America,” said Public Advocate Letitia James. “And no ban will stop us.”
